metadata.title: CVE-2022-4415 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in systemd. This security flaw can cause a localinformation leak due to systemd-coredump not respecting thefs.suid_dumpable kernel setting.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4415` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7
libnss-mymachines - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7
libnss-resolve - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7
libnss-systemd - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7
libpam-systemd - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7
libsystemd0 - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7
libudev1 - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7
systemd - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7
systemd-container - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7
systemd-coredump - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7
systemd-journal-remote - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7
systemd-oomd - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7
systemd-repart - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7
systemd-standalone-sysusers - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7
systemd-standalone-tmpfiles - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7
systemd-sysv - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7
systemd-tests - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7
systemd-timesyncd - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7
udev - 249.11-0ubuntu3.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemd package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '249.11-0ubuntu3.7').
